intro: Allozygia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the nightshade family and is characterized by its delicate, white, bell-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Allozygia thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in woodlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
